actions.text: Referred to House Committee on House Administration.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to change from more than $100 to more than $500 the amount with respect to which certain reports of contributions are required to be filed with the Federal Election Commission.

summary.text: Challenges Protection Act of 1979 - Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to increase to $500 the amount of campaign contributions a congressional candidate who is not an incumbent may receive from a single source during one year without having to file a report thereon with the Federal Election Commission.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to change from more than $100 to more than $500 the amount with respect to which certain reports of contributions are required to be filed with the Federal Election Commission.
